Podcast Name: The Rewatcher: Buffy the Vampire Slayer
Description: Welcome to the Hellmouth Weirdos! Your favorite Morbid hosts Ash and Alaina are branching out from true crime and heading to Sunnydale for the ultimate Buffy the Vampire Slayer Rewatch podcast! Alaina is a Buffy superfan and Ash has never watched a single episode, so whether you’re Team Angel, Team Spike, or have no clue who those people are…they’ve got you covered! Join them each week as they slay their way through the series, episode by episode, re-watching, and watching for the very first time. They’ll break down Buffy and her friends adventures through weekly recaps, categories, and awards while Ash takes some (wooden stake) stabs at predicting what she thinks will happen next. They'll also welcome the occasional Buffy cast member, guest star, or celebrity superfan to join in the slaying.New episodes come out every Monday or you can listen early on Amazon Music or early and ad-free by subscribing to Wondery+ on Apple Podcasts or in the Wondery app.

Podcast Name: Myth Taken: A Buffy the Vampire Slayer Podcat
Description: Hosts Laine and Cory discuss episodes, seasons, mythology, and folklore related to one of the best shows ever: Buffy the Vampire Slayer!

Podcast Name: Slayerfest98 (A Buffy the Vampire Slayer Podcast)
Description: A Queer Latinx Buffy the Vampire Slayer Podcast that occasionally covers Marvel stuff.

Podcast Name: Buffy the Gilmore Slayer: A Buffy and Gilmore Girls Podcast
Description: The one and only Gilmore Girls AND Buffy the Vampire Slayer podcast brought to you by comedians/real life couple Bryan Morris & Stacey Kulow. Bryan grew up obsessed with Buffy the Vampire Slayer, and Stacey is a huge Gilmore Girls fan, but neither of them have ever seen the other's favorite show. Together they watch their way through both excellent 7-season series, discussing an episode from each show every week, in an attempt to figure out which show is better. Bryan & Stacey are New York-based writer/performers, both born and raised in the Midwest. They met doing improv in Madison, Wisconsin and have been together for over a decade.
Joe Welkie and Vance Tucker watch Buffy the Vampire Slayer for the first time ever and share their thoughts on every episode.

Podcast Name: Poorly Read Podcast - Season 3: Buffy the Vampire Slayer

Season 2: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe/Twilight - The first two books of these best-selling series are given the brutal Poorly Read treatment. With ice cream on top.  Season 1: Harry Potter - The magical journey through Hogwarts revisited through jaded, adult eyes…

A podcast discussing the themes, metaphors, and symbolism in the hit TV show, "Buffy the Vampire Slayer." Join sisters Sarah, Tabby, and Leah as they dissect the show with a spoiler-free analysis for new watchers, and also a spoiler-filled analysis for long time fans.

Podcast Name: Still Pretty, a Buffy the Vampire Slayer podcast

Description: A Buffy the Vampire Slayer rewatch podcast. Join Steph and Kara as they recap and review every episode from the beginning. This podcast is spoiler-free and friendly to first-time watchers.

Description: A retro analytical love roast of Buffy The Vampire Slayer and its spin off Angel.

A podcast where Kyle and Zach - your two favorite gays - discuss, analyze, and poke fun at the seminal teen-horror-supernatural-drama show Buffy the Vampire Slayer. What holds up? What doesn’t? And most importantly, how gay is it?

A podcast where each week we will revisit an episode of the television shows, "Buffy the Vampire Slayer" and "Angel" and discuss them in depth. We will give details of behind the scenes happenings as well as our take on each scene and the overall experience of the show.

Harrison and Jason are discussing every episode of "Buffy the Vampire Slayer" and "Angel". Spoiler-free and maybe just a little tipsy. Join us as we talk Buffy, booze, and the 90s.  Twitter and Instagram: @boozeandbuffy  Email: boozeandbuffy@gmail.com
A podcast where Australians talk about Buffy the Vampire Slayer episode by episode.

Those who love Buffy the Vampire Slayer know that 25 years later, it can sometimes leave us feeling more bothered & bewildered than bewitched. A lot has changed since the show premiered in 1997. The creator of the show once said ‘bring your own subtext,’ so we're doing just that. We wouldn’t be doing the Buffyverse justice to love it blindly, so let's break it down. Join Kate, Frankie, & Kate as we, for better or worse, rewatch a series that means so much to us.   Join our podclub on the Fable app! https://fable.co/club/bothered-bewildered-with-kate-frankie-and-kate-838161179151

Two boyfriends who won't stop talking about their English Lit degrees comment on a girl who saved the world, a lot.  A weekly re-watch of 'Buffy the Vampire Slayer' from an LGBTQ, feminist, and literary perspective (also wine!).   New episodes released every Wednesday.

Podcast Name: Once more with feeling, our Buffy the Vampire Slayer podcast.
Description: Welcome to Nerd Subculture podcast where Edwina & Jarrod discuss everything from TV show, movies, music and video games. Currently doing a re watch of Buffy the Vampire Slayer.

Podcast Name: Big Miss Stake: A Buffy Podcast
Description: We're two goth-adjacent friends. Aditi has never watched Buffy the Vampire Slayer, and Melissa's entire life was shaped by it. Join us as we experience it together in a learning and friendship (and spoiler-free!) adventure. Hot new high-stakes episodes released every two weeks.

Podcast Name: Buffy and the Art of Story
Description: If you love Buffy the Vampire Slayer, and you love creating stories….

Podcast Name: The Sunnydale Review: A Buffy the Vampire Slayer Podcast
Description: Each week Jillian and Brian rewatch a group of episodes from the classic show Buffy the Vampire Slayer and talk about it.

buffy speak is a podcast about buffy the vampire slayer, which beth has seen upwards of ten million times and caroline is watching for the first time. we try to come at the show from an intersectional perspective and have a ton of fun with it. we hope you do too!
The new dynamic duo discuss one of the most influential TV shows of all time. B has seen every episode, Money has seen none!

I've never seen Buffy the Vampire Slayer. But for whatever reason all my friends are fanatics. In this podcast, Horror Expert, Denis St. John forces 1 friend, me, to watch Buffy the Vampire Slayer from beginning to end, 1 week at a time.

Podcast Name: How I Ripped Off Buffy The Vampire Slayer
Description: When award nominated screenwriter Chip Thompson was 14, he was mildly obsessed with Buffy the Vampire Slayer, comic books and a whole manner of geeky pop culture. So he decided to write his own series, centering around what it would be like if he and best friend/Co host MC were supernatural, crime fighting ninjas in Tokyo.   It was as terrible as it sounds, full of plagerism, clumsy references and out right stealing of ideas mixed with its own unique blend of B Movie horror and superhero plots and ideas.   Now, 17 years later, Chip and MC read through each episode of this series (much to Chip's chagrin), brought to life with their unique acting skills.  Whether you're a Buffy fan, or enjoy works such as Gareth Margenghi's Darkplace, My Dad Wrote a Porno, the Evil Dead or just like to hear a grown man wince at his teenage ramblings, we think you'll enjoy the How I Ripped Off Buffy The Vampire Slayer podcast.   Available on iTunes, SoundCloud, YouTube and Stitcher Radio. You can find us on Facebook at facebook.com/howirippedoffpodcast and on Twitter, @HowIRippedOff

Podcast Name: Gym Was Cancelled: A Buffy Podcast
Description: Buffy the Vampire Slayer Veteran, Jess Jurhs and Buffy the Vampire Slayer Virgin, Zach Stasch embark on an epic quest to watch the show and discuss in detail!

Podcast Name: We Are The Gayers | A Buffy Podcast
Description: We Are The Gayers is a fully spoiled, queer, deep dive Buffy the Vampire Slayer podcast, recorded in order of how much we like the seasons and released every full moon.

3 Earpers, a random chance encounter at a con lead to a friendship. Amongst their chats it was discovered, one of them had never had the amazing experience of Buffy the Vampire Slayer. Thus leading to a hilarious weekly podcast discussing Buffy and its similarities to what ultimately brought them together... Earp.

Bob and Chelsea, two longtime fans, review and discuss their takes on every episode of Buffy the Vampire Slayer.

Podcast Name: Tabula Rasa, B!tches!: A Buffy Rewatch Show
Description: In Tabula Rasa, B!tches!: A Buffy Rewatch Show, you'll listen as besties Allie Press and Nick Mercer jump back into the world of Buffy the Vampire Slayer and bask in their love for all things Buffy. Rewatching each episode from the beginning, Allie and Nick will discuss their favorite quotes, lessons learned, new takeaways, and more. Find Tabula Rasa, B!tches! wherever you listen to your podcasts and connect on all social media at @tabularasabpod.

Podcast Name: The Chosen Two - A Buffy Rewatch
Description: Rewatching Buffy The Vampire Slayer with hosts Mel and Tilda. Winners of the Buffy trivia...first of their name...and The Chosen Two. Episode by episode we will take you through this incredible show, give you facts you never knew and of course butt heads with our opinions! THIS PODCAST CONTAINS SPOILERS. It’s been 25 years people ..

Buffy Sainte-Marie is one of the most prolific singer-songwriters of the past century. For 60 years her music has quietly reverberated throughout pop culture, and provided a touchstone for Indigenous resistance. In this five-part series, Mohawk and Tuscarora writer Falen Johnson explores how Buffy’s life and legacy is essential to understanding Indigenous resilience.
An episode by episode breakdown of Buffy the Vampire Slayer.

It's been 25 years since Buffy Summers rolled into Sunnydale and into our geeky hearts. Live back through all the nerdy and classic 90s goodness as various age ranges give their opinions on the classic series Buffy the Vampire Slayer, 25 years later. From the very particular dialogue to the wardrobe to the technology and everywhere in between, it's a discussion only Clock Shelves Entertainment can provide you.

Podcast Name: What's This Bitch Talking About? (a Buffy Podcast)
Description: This bitch recaps/reviews/rants about every episode of Buffy the Vampire Slayer exactly 20 years after its original airdate.   NOTE: This bitch's podcast is confusing and at times, the numbering sequence of the episodes doesn't seem to make sense. If you're looking for the other episodes that used to be here, they are on my SoundCloud.  Please direct all love letters to mixtressrae@protonmail.com
Just a couple of grown, Blerd women, Kahmeela and Marcella, going back to Sunnydale & talking Buffy. One episode at a time.
Two anonymous queers talk about Buffy the Vampire Slayer episode by episode.

Description: Two best friends watch every single episode of Buffy the Vampire Slayer. Gianna owns a stake and roams graveyards. Marlee has barely heard of it and thinks Spike is hot, but who the heck is Angel?Pod Art by Erik GriceHosted and Produced by Marlee Yule & Gianna VacircaEditing Wizard & Tech Support & Musical Stylings & Produced by Oscar Derkx

A Buffy fanatic and a total Buffy newcomer discover the Buffyverse by watching each episode and breaking it down to all the bloody details.

Two Buffy neophytes join two vets to discuss Buffy the Vampire Slayer's place in the current cultural landscape. Can you believe that Buffy is over twenty years old? It's probably better not to think about it.
A Buffy the Vampire Slayer podcast covering one episode at a time. Expect laughter! Expect tears! Expect frequent criticism of Joyce's parenting!

Podcast Name: Invite Me In: A Buffy Podcast
Description: Two superfans (Xander and Jess) and one 'first timer' (Trav) try to convince a 'never see' (Jim) to watch an episode of Buffy the Vampire Slayer. Will Jim give in? Will the superfans cry in defeat? Will Trav join forces with Jim and rage against the Superfans?! Stay tuned to find out!  Buffy the Vampire Slayer is an American television series created by Joss Whedon. The show aired from 1997 to 2003, and has remained popular in the years since. Buffy was a groundbreaking show for its time, featuring a female lead character who was not just one of many pretty faces or one of many damsels in distress.  The show follows Buffy Summers (played by Sarah Michelle Gellar), a high school student chosen by fate to battle evil forces as The Slayer. She is aided by her Watcher, Rupert Giles (Anthony Head), who teaches her about the history of vampires and other supernatural creatures that inhabit the Earth; her mother's new husband, Hank Summers (Danny Strong); and her best friends Willow Rosenberg (Alyson Hannigan) and Xander Harris (Nicholas Brendon).

Join Brianne and Marybeth as they rewatch their favorite show from high school, Buffy The Vampire Slayer. Each week they will rewatch the episodes and hopefully they will have facts and insights that you didn't know or think about.
Each week, hosts Natalie and Katey cover two episodes of "Buffy the Vampire Slayer," in celebration of Buffy's 20th anniversary.
Every Tuesday I will discuss an episode of Buffy the Vampire Slayer! Of course going in order.
Daily reflections on PCOS weight loss, motherhood and life. Also episode recaps of my favorite show Buffy the Vampire Slayer.
Just three guys who thought this would be a great idea.  "Why waste our stupid conversations???"  This is gonna be interesting...

Podcast Name: Into Every Generation a Slayer Is Born: How Buffy Staked Our Hearts
Description:
Author(s): Evan Ross Katz Narrator(s): Evan Ross Katz, Deanna Anthony

Explore the history and cultural impact of a groundbreaking television show adored by old and new fans alike: Buffy the Vampire Slayer.

Over the course of its seven-year run, Buffy the Vampire Slayer cultivated a loyal fandom and featured a strong, complex female lead, at a time when such a character was a rarity. Evan Ross Katz explores the show’s cultural relevance through a book that is part oral history, part celebration, and part memoir of a personal fandom that has universal resonance still, decades later.

Katz—with the help of the show’s cast, creators, and crew—reveals that although Buffy contributed to important conversations about gender, sexuality, and feminism, it was not free of internal strife, controversy, and shortcomings. Men—both on screen and off—would taint the show’s reputation as a feminist masterpiece, and changing networks, amongst other factors, would drastically alter the show’s tone.

Katz addresses these issues and more, including interviews with stars Sarah Michelle Gellar, Charisma Carpenter, Emma Caulfield, Amber Benson, James Marsters, Anthony Stewart Head, Seth Green, Marc Blucas, Nicholas Brendon, Danny Strong, Tom Lenk, Bianca Lawson, Julie Benz, Clare Kramer, K. Todd Freeman, Sharon Ferguson; and writers Douglas Petrie, Jane Espenson, and Drew Z. Greenberg; as well as conversations with Buffy fanatics and friends of the cast including Stacey Abrams, Cynthia Erivo, Lee Pace, Claire Saffitz, Tavi Gevinson, and Selma Blair.

Into Every Generation a Slayer Is Born engages with the very notion of fandom, and the ways a show like Buffy can influence not only how we see the world but how we exist within it.
we love each other, one of us loves Buffy, the other has never seen it!

Podcast Name: Buffy contra los vampiros: el podcast
Description: El podcast en el que hablamos de Buffy Cazavampiros. Cada semana, un capítulo.

Podcast Name: Slayers & Vampires: The Complete Uncensored, Unauthorized Oral History of Buffy & Angel
Description:
Author(s): Edward Gross, Mark A. Altman Narrator(s): Julie McKay, James Patrick Cronin Two decades after its groundbreaking debut, millions of fans worldwide remain enthralled with the incredible exploits of Joss Whedon's Buffy Summers, the slayer and feminist icon who saved the world . . .a lot; as well as Angel, the tortured vampire with a soul who fought against the apocalyptic forces of evil.

Now, go behind-the-scenes of these legendary series that ushered in the new Golden Age of Television, with the candid recollections of writers, creators, executives, programmers, critics, and cast members. Together they unveil the oftentimes shocking true story of how a failed motion picture became an acclaimed cult television series, how that show became a pawn between two networks, and the spin-off series that was as engaging as everything that came before.

This is the amazing true story of Buffy and the friends, vampires, slayers, and demons who changed television forever.
